title: psc-vignette
text: psc.R package implements methods applying Personalised Synthetic Controls, allows patients receiving experimental treatment compared model predicts reponse control. form causal inference differes approaches Causal inference, theory least, estimated patient level - opposed estimating average effects population causal estimand obtained Average Treatment Effect Treated (ATT) differs Average Treatment Effect (ATE) obtained settings addresses question whether treatments effective population patients treated. estimand targets efficacy effectivness. basic form, method creates likelihood compare cohort data parametric model. See (X) disucssion ’s use causal inference tool. use package, two basic peices information required, dataset model can compared. vignette, detail psc.r package constructed give examples ’s application practice.

title: psc-vignette
text: pscfit function compares dataset (‘DC’) parametric model. done selecting likelihood identified type CFM supplied. present, two types model supported, flexible parmaeteric survival model type ‘flexsurvreg’ geleneralised linear model type ‘glm’. CFM type ‘flexsurvreg’ likeihood supplied form: L(D∣Λ,Γi)=∏=1nf(ti∣Λ,Γi)ciS(ti∣Γ,Λi)(1−ci)L(D∣\Lambda,\Gamma_i)=\prod_{=1}^{n} f(t_i∣\Lambda,\Gamma_i)^{c_i}  S(t_i∣\Gamma,\Lambda_i)^{(1−c_i)} Γ\Gamma defines cumulative baseline hazard function, Λ\Lambda linear predictor tt cc event time indicator variables. CFM type ‘glm’ likelihood supplied form: L(x∣Γi)=∏=1nb(x∣Γi)exp{Γit(x)−c(Γi)}L(x∣\Gamma_i) = \prod_{=1}^{n} b (x∣ \Gamma_i )\exp\{\Gamma_i t(x)− c(\Gamma_i)\} b(.)b(.), t(.)t(.) c(.)c(.) represent functions exponential family. cases, Γ\Gamma defiend : Γi=γxi+β \Gamma_i = \gamma x_i+\beta γ\gamma model coefficients supplied CFM β\beta parameter set measure difference CFM DC. Estimation performed using Bayesian MCMC procedure. Prior distributions Γ\Gamma (& Λ\Lambda) derived directly model coefficients (mean variance covariance matrix) CFM. bespoke MCMC routine performed estimate β\beta. Please see ‘?mcmc’ detials. standard example DC contains information single treatment, trt need specified. comparisons CFM multiple treatments require, covariate treamtne allocations must specified sperately (using ‘trt’ option).

title: psc-vignette
text: main function using applying Personal Synthetic Controls pscfit() function two inputs, Counter-Factual Model (CFM) data cohort (DC). arguments include nsim sets number MCMC iterations (defaults 5000) ‘id’ user wishes restrict estimation sub-set (individual) within DC ‘trt’ used initial identifier mulitple treatment comparisons made (please see Mulitple Treatment Comparison )

title: psc-vignette
text: output “pscfit()” function object class ‘psc’. class contains following attributes definition calss model supplied ‘cleaned’ dataset including extracted components CFM cleaned DC included procedure object defingin class model (therefore procedure applied - see ) matrix containing draws posterior distributions

title: psc-vignette
text: basic post estimation functions developed work psc object, namely “print()”, “coef()”, “summary()” “plot()”. first three provided basic summaries efficacy parameter obtained posterior distribution.

title: psc-vignette
text: psc.r package includes example dataset derived patients pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC) received experimental treatment, case GemCap. dataset named ‘e4_data’ loaded enviroment using “data()” function Included list prognostic covariates: nodes: patient lymph node status; negative (n=1) positive (n=2) lymph nodes grade: tumour grade; 1,2 3 lca199: log transformed ca19.9 t: T-stage; (1,2 3) Also included following structures time - survival time cen - censoring indictor give esamples ‘pscfit()’ function can used comapre data models survival outcomes (‘flexsurvreg’ model). Examples perform analyses using GLM model objects available github repo https://github.com/richJJackson/psc
code: #install.packages("psc") library(psc) library(ggpubr) #> Loading required package: ggplot2 e4_data <- psc::e4_data

title: psc-vignette
text: example survival outcome model must supplied contructed ont basis flexible parametric splines. contructed using “flexsurvreg” function within “flexsurv” package. example included within ‘psc.r’ package names ‘surv.mod’ loaded using ’data()” function: ‘gemCFM’ object calss pscCFM means contains structures required analysis stripped model object patient level data. Included instead summary table: …set visualisations arrange using ggarrange  example can see model constructed 3 internal knots hence 5 parameters describe baseline cumulative hazard function. also prognostic covariates match prognostic covariates data cohort. Comparing dataset model performed using can view attributes psc object created example view matrix contianing draws posterior distribution use Inspection show column parameter original model well ‘beta’ ‘DIC’ vcolumns give teh posterior estiamtes β\beta Deviance Informaiton Criterion respectively. can inspect poterior distribution using autocorrelation function, trace stardard summary statistics:

title: psc-vignette
psc-vignette
psc-vignette
text: Standard ‘summary()’ function wil summarise model fit visualise original model fit data, plot function developed
code: summary(surv.psc) #> Summary:  #>   #> 311 observations selected from the data cohort for comparison  #> CFM of type flexsurvreg identified   #> linear predictor succesfully obtained with median:  #>  trt: 1.786 #> Average expected response:  #>  trt: 30.077 #> Average observed response: 26.327  #>  #> Counterfactual Model (CFM):  #> A model of class 'flexsurvreg'  #>  Fit with 3 internal knots #>  #> Formula:  #> s.ob ~ t + grade + nodes + lca199 #> <environment: 0x55dca2c836d8> #>  #> Call: #>  CFM model + beta #>  #> Coefficients: #>       median     2.5%       97.5%      Pr(x<0)    Pr(x>0)   #> beta   -0.25020   -0.44084   -0.06284    0.99520    0.00480 #> DIC   844.64311  837.88243  857.62927         NA         NA plot(surv.psc)

code: summary(surv.psc) #> Summary:  #>   #> 311 observations selected from the data cohort for comparison  #> CFM of type flexsurvreg identified   #> linear predictor succesfully obtained with median:  #>  trt: 1.786 #> Average expected response:  #>  trt: 30.077 #> Average observed response: 26.327  #>  #> Counterfactual Model (CFM):  #> A model of class 'flexsurvreg'  #>  Fit with 3 internal knots #>  #> Formula:  #> s.ob ~ t + grade + nodes + lca199 #> <environment: 0x5596cf2385e8> #>  #> Call: #>  CFM model + beta #>  #> Coefficients: #>       median     2.5%       97.5%      Pr(x<0)    Pr(x>0)   #> beta   -0.25020   -0.44084   -0.06284    0.99520    0.00480 #> DIC   844.64311  837.88243  857.62927         NA         NA plot(surv.psc)

text: CFM model object supplied pscfit DC dataset including covariates match CFM id vector specifiying whether subset dataset selected. Defaults 'NULL' e.g. data points included trt optional additional vector denoting treatment allocations multiple treatment comparisons.  Defaults 'NULL' cfmOb used specify CFM object supplies counter factual model

title: Function for performing estimation procedures in 'pscfit' — pscEst
text: matrix containing draws form posterior distribution

title: Function for performing estimation procedures in 'pscfit' — pscEst
text: Define set model parameters \(B\) contain \(\Gamma\) summarize parameters CFM. Prior distributions defined B using multivariate normal distribution \(\pi (B) \sim MVN(\mu ,\Sigma)\) \(\mu|\) vector coefficient estimates validated model \(\Sigma\) variance-covariance matrix. information taken directly outputs parametric model elicitation required. prior distirbution efficacy parameter (\(\pi{(\beta)}\)) set uniformative \(N(0,1000)\). Ultimately aim estimate posterior distribution \(\beta\) conditional distribution B observed data.  full form posterior distribution given $$P(\beta \vert B,D) \propto L(D \vert B,\beta) \pi(B) \pi(\beta)$$ Please see 'pscfit' details liklihood formation. iteration MCMC procedure, following algorithm performed Set indicator s=1, define initial state based prior hyperparameters \(\pi(B)\)  \(\pi(\beta)\) \(b_s = \mu \tau_s=0\) Update \(s = s+1\) draw model parameters \(b_s\) \(\pi(B)\) draw proposal estimate \(\beta\) target distribution Estimate \(\Gamma_(,S)=\nu^T x_i\) \(\nu\) subset parameters \(b_s\)  relate model covariates define 2 new likelihood functions    \(\Theta_(s,1)=L(D \vert B=b_s,\beta=\tau_(s-1) )\) & \(\Theta_(s,2)= L(D \vert B=b_s,\beta=\tau_s)\) Draw single value \(\psi\) Uniform (0,1) distribution estimate condition \(\omega=  \Theta_(s,1)/\Theta_(s,2)\). \(\omega > \psi\) accept \(\tau_s\) belonging posterior distribution \(P(\beta \vert B,D)\) otherwise retain \(\tau_(s-1)\) Repeat steps 2 – 4 required number iterations result algorithm posterior distribution log hazard ratio, \(\beta\), captures variability B defined priors \(\pi{(\beta)}\).

what: Personalised Synthetic Controls model fit — pscfit
title: Personalised Synthetic Controls model fit — pscfit
text: Function allows comparison data cohort parametric Counter Factual Model (CFM). function allows models type 'flexsurvreg' 'glm' supplied. function performs calculating linear predictor combination CFM dataset supplied selects likelihood based type model specified.  Likelihood estimated using Baysian MCMC procedure wherebey parameters CFM acts informative priors.

title: Personalised Synthetic Controls model fit — pscfit
code: pscfit(CFM, DC, nsim = 5000, id = NULL, trt = NULL)

title: Personalised Synthetic Controls model fit — pscfit
text: CFM R model object class 'glm' 'flexsurvspline' DC dataset including columns match covariates model nsim number simulations MCMC routine id Numeric vector stating patient(s) dataset included analysis. Defaults patients trt optional vector denoting treatment allocations multiple treatment comparisons.  Defaults NULL.

title: Personalised Synthetic Controls model fit — pscfit
text: object class 'psc' attributes model.type, cleaned Dataset   posterior distribution fitted model Attributes include 'cleaned' dataset including extracted components CFM  cleaned DC included procedure object defining class model (therefore procedure  applied - see ) matrix containing draws posterior distributions

title: Personalised Synthetic Controls model fit — pscfit
text: Model currently supports estimation one treatment (using 'trt') option esitmation restricted sub-groups data cohort (using 'id' option. pscfit function compares dataset ('DC') parametric model.   done selecting likelihood identified type CFM supplied.   present, two types model supported, flexible parmaeteric survival model type 'flexsurvreg'   geleneralised linear model type 'glm'. CFM type 'flexsurvreg' likeihood supplied form: $$L(D \vert \Lambda, \Gamma_i) = \prod^{n}_{=1} f(t_i \vert  \Lambda, \Gamma_i)^{c_i}   S(t_i|\Lambda, \Gamma_i)^{(1-c_i)}$$ \(\Lambda\) defines cumulative baseline hazard function,   \(\Gamma\) linear predictor \(t\) \(c\)   event time indicator variables. CFM type 'glm' likelihood supplied form: $$L(x \vert \Gamma_i) = \prod^{n}_{=1} b(x \vert \Gamma_i) \exp{\{\Gamma_i^T t(x)    - c(\Gamma_i)\} } $$ \(b(.)\), \(t(.)\) \(c(.)\) represent functions   exponential family. cases, \(\Gamma\) defined : $$\Gamma = \gamma x + \beta$$ \(\gamma\) model coefficients supplied CFM \(\beta\)   parameter set measure difference CFM DC. Estimation performed using Bayesian MCMC procedure.  Prior distributions    \(\Gamma\) (& \(\Lambda\)) derived directly model    coefficients (mean variance covariance matrix) CFM. bespoke MCMC    routine performed estimate \(\beta\).  Please see '?mcmc' detials. standard example DC contains information single    treatment, trt need specified.  comparisons CFM    multiple treatments require, covariate treamtne allocations must    specified sperately (using 'trt' option).
